tournament.name: Rivals League - November Zendikar Rising Weekend

decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to enable a flicker strategy. It includes a mix of powerful creatures like Baneslayer Angel, Dream Trawler, and Skyclave Apparition, along with card advantage engines like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. It also includes control elements such as Shatter the Sky and counterspells like Negate and Essence Scatter. The deck aims to control the board early on with cards like Glass Casket and emerge into a more powerful late-game with threats like Thassa, Deep-Dwelling and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a large board of creatures and then using Zenith Flare as a finisher to deal massive damage to the opponent. It also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value by recasting cheap cycling creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and win the game quickly before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through mill and removal spells while utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion. By constantly milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber, and disrupting their strategy with counterspells and removal spells, the deck aims to deplete their resources and win through card advantage and graveyard recursion. The key strategy is to outlast the opponent by maintaining control of the board and hand advantage while slowly grinding them down with a combination of mill and removal effects.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly take control of the game. By utilizing evasive creatures like Nighthawk Scavenger and Merfolk Windrobber, along with powerful removal spells like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while keeping their board clear. With key cards like Zareth San, the Trickster and Into the Story providing card advantage and additional threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and slowing down the opponent's pace through removal spells, enchantments, and creatures that generate value. The main goal is to outvalue the opponent by consistently generating card advantage with cards like Yorion, Skyclave Apparition, and Mazemind Tome, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to stabilize the board and then overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Archon of Sun's Grace.

The key focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes while generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sun and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to outvalue opponents in the long game while maintaining board presence and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on creating a strong board presence while controlling the opponent's resources through removal spells and enchantments. It utilizes cards like Skyclave Apparition and Glass Casket to deal with threats, while cards like Doom Foretold and Extinction Event help maintain control of the game. With the ability to blink cards like Charming Prince and Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and maximizing the deck's potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and card advantage engines. By utilizing cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value from sacrificing permanents. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as both a companion and a way to flicker key permanents for additional value. The deck can win through attrition by overwhelming the opponent with threats generated from cards like Dance of the Manse and Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, board wipes, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value through blinking permanents for card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to outlast the opponent by gradually gaining incremental advantages through card draw, token generation, and recursive threats like Dream Trawler and Elspeth Conquers Death. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and creating value through blinking permanents with Yorion, Sky Nomad. It runs a suite of removal spells and card draw to maintain control of the game. The deck also utilizes powerful enchantments like Elspeth Conquers Death and Doom Foretold to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and disruptive threats, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition.

The deck aims to control the board through various removal spells, board wipes, and enchantments, while generating card advantage and value through recurring creatures and artifacts with Yorion, Sky Nomad. The inclusion of cards such as Skyclave Apparition, Shatter the Sky, and Elspeth Conquers Death allows the player to consistently answer threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes Dance of the Manse to bring back key enchantments and artifacts from the graveyard, providing additional value and resource management.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing opponents by utilizing cards that remove threats and generate card advantage. The key strategy involves using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to blink permanents for additional value, while also utilizing cards like Elspeth Conquers Death, Skyclave Apparition, and Doom Foretold to control the board. The deck also includes multiple forms of card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency in playing its powerful spells. Overall, the deck aims to grind opponents out over the course of a long game.

The focus of this Esper Control deck is to control the board through removal spells and enchantments, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate card advantage and value through blinking permanents. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by recurring threats with Dance of the Manse, utilizing Doom Foretold to disrupt their game plan, and setting up powerful late-game plays with Emeria's Call. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and selection tools to ensure consistency in finding key pieces to establish control over the game.

This Esper Control deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and enchantments, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as its companion to provide additional value. The deck aims to stabilize the game with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Doom Foretold, while also generating card advantage with Mazemind Tome and Treacherous Blessing. By utilizing a blend of removal, enchantments, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win over the course of a longer game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counters, and enchantments. The deck aims to generate card advantage and stabilize the battlefield with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death, Skyclave Apparition, and Doom Foretold. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a powerful flicker effect to generate additional value from the deck's enter-the-battlefield triggers. The deck also includes a mix of removal, card draw, and board wipes to maintain control of the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board by utilizing removal spells such as Eliminate, Heartless Act, and Extinction Event. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome, Omen of the Sea, and Shark Typhoon. Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death help to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion and allows for additional value through blinking permanents. Overall, the deck focuses on outvaluing opponents and maintaining control of the game through a mix of removal, card draw, and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and out-value them in the late game. By utilizing powerful enchantments like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death, along with card advantage engines like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Dance of the Manse, the deck can generate a lot of value over time. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base with various pathways and Fabled Passage to ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient creatures, backed up by powerful support cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge. The deck aims to establish a fast and aggressive board presence, utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Brushfire Elemental, and Questing Beast to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and creature threats like Scavenging Ooze provide versatility and resilience. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate serves as a source of card advantage and additional threats, ensuring the deck can maintain pressure throughout the game.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant. By utilizing cards like Brushfire Elemental and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent quickly while also maintaining card advantage through Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. With a mix of removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent early on and secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental, Lovestruck Beast, and Questing Beast to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage early in the game. Supporting these creatures are powerful spells like Embercleave and The Great Henge to provide additional damage and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to deal with opposing threats. With a strong mana base and a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly putting out aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental, Kazandu Mammoth, and Bonecrusher Giant to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck also includes powerful artifact cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave to further enhance the aggression of the creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Shatterskull Smashing to clear the opponent's creatures and make way for more attacks. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and finish them off with powerful combat tricks and removal spells.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast. The deck aims to maintain board control through removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embereth Shieldbreaker while also generating card advantage with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. With powerful finishers like Embercleave and Questing Beast, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, aggression, and resilience.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, backed up by removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave to clear the way for attacks. The Great Henge provides card draw and life gain to keep the pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Kazandu Mammoth and Questing Beast allows for resilience against control decks. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By consistently applying pressure with creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Brushfire Elemental, while utilizing removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Scorching Dragonfire to clear the way, the deck aims to close out games efficiently. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave provide additional sources of power and flexibility, allowing for explosive plays and maintaining momentum throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Brushfire Elemental, supported by powerful spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave. The Great Henge provides extra card draw and ramp, while cards like Fire Prophecy and Shatterskull Smashing help with removal and reach. The deck also includes cards like Scavenging Ooze and Kazandu Mammoth for additional threats and versatility. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent curve, with Evolving Wilds and Fabled Passage helping with color fixing.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using them to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The main strategy involves playing efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant while ramping up with cards like The Great Henge and Kazandu Mammoth. Embercleave is used to give a boost to key attackers, while removal spells like Fire Prophecy and The Akroan War help control the board. The deck also includes some utility lands and cards to maintain consistency and versatility in different situations.

This Aggro deck focuses on playing creatures with powerful abilities early on to apply pressure to the opponent. It utilizes efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, while also taking advantage of cards like Edgewall Innkeeper to draw cards and generate value. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and use cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to finish off the opponent. Shatterskull Smashing and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide additional removal and card advantage. The deck's strategy is to be proactive and close out games quickly.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, along with equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Embereth Shieldbreaker provide additional utility and disruption against opposing strategies. The deck also includes some card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate to help maintain tempo and push towards victory. With a solid mana base and a well-rounded curve, this deck is built to apply pressure and close out games fast.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful combat tricks and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It synergizes well with the Gruul color combination, utilizing efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast alongside powerful spells like Embercleave and The Great Henge. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to both red and green mana sources. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence to close out games swiftly.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The main components include powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Kazandu Mammoth, as well as creatures that provide card advantage like Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck also includes removal options such as Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy, as well as tools for ramping and mana fixing like Fabled Passage and Evolving Wilds. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and deal massive damage with the help of Embercleave and The Great Henge.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using a combination of creatures with high power and low cost. By utilizing cards like Brushfire Elemental, Bonecrusher Giant, and Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly deal damage and take control of the board. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Gemrazer provide additional utility and versatility to handle various threats. Overall, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and apply constant pressure to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Brushfire Elemental. It utilizes powerful cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to pump up creatures and deliver big hits. The deck also has removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to deal with threats from the opponent. With a solid mana base and card draw potential from Edgewall Innkeeper and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant alongside powerful equipment like Embercleave, this deck seeks to put pressure on the opponent early and often. With a strong mana base and card draw options, this deck is designed to maintain momentum and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental, Kazandu Mammoth, and Bonecrusher Giant. By utilizing cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave, it aims to deal significant damage to the opponent in a short amount of time. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Primal Might to deal with opposing threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Brushfire Elemental. The goal is to pressure the opponent early and often, using cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge to push damage through and maintain card advantage. Gemrazer provides versatility and disruption, while the mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of aggression and high-impact plays.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature cards, focusing on quick and powerful attacks. With a mix of strong creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, along with powerful support cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game. Additionally, card advantage and mana acceleration provided by cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate help ensure the deck's consistency and ability to close out games efficiently.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient and powerful creatures early on to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence with cards like Lovestruck Beast and Kazandu Mammoth, while using removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to control the board. The deck aims to finish off the opponent quickly with the help of Embercleave and The Great Henge, providing additional power and reach. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for aggressive plays throughout the game.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. By playing powerful creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental, the deck aims to deal damage early and often. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave provide additional ways to pump up creatures and finish off opponents. The deck also includes some removal in the form of Shatterskull Smashing and Scorching Dragonfire to deal with any threats the opponent may play. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful combat tricks. The deck aims to generate card advantage by utilizing creatures like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast, while also applying pressure with cards like Embercleave and Questing Beast. The deck's mana base supports its aggressive strategy by providing a mix of both red and green sources to cast its creatures and spells efficiently. Overall, the key concept revolves around fast-paced, creature-centric gameplay to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with aggressive mono green creatures. By utilizing powerful cards such as Feasting Troll King, Wicked Wolf, and Lovestruck Beast, combined with cards like Trail of Crumbs and The Great Henge to generate card advantage and ramp, this deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The mana base is focused on efficiently casting your creatures and spells, with utility lands like Castle Garenbrig and Bonders' Enclave to provide additional benefits.

The main concept of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to flood the board with powerful creatures quickly and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. With a focus on generating mana efficiently and utilizing creature synergies, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Trail of Crumbs provide additional card advantage and resilience to removal, ensuring that the deck can continue its aggressive strategy even in the face of disruption.

The main focus of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to utilize Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to create a strong board presence and control the game. The deck includes a mix of creatures like Charming Prince and Archon of Sun's Grace, removal spells like Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth's Nightmare, and enchantments like Omen of the Sun and Elspeth Conquers Death. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruption while taking advantage of Yorion's ability to flicker permanents for additional value.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures while also utilizing powerful removal spells and card advantage to control the board. The deck focuses on establishing a strong board presence early on with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Wicked Wolf, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value. The inclusion of cards like Trail of Crumbs and Elspeth Conquers Death allows the deck to maintain card advantage and deal with opposing threats efficiently. The deck also has some powerful late-game options like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out games if needed.

The main concept of this deck is to build a fast and aggressive board presence using creatures like Wicked Wolf and Skyclave Apparition, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad for extra value and card advantage. The deck aims to keep up the pressure on the opponent while also generating additional resources through cards like Trail of Crumbs and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck while also providing flexibility for casting the various spells and creatures.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to control the board with removal spells like Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth Conquers Death, while also utilizing value engines like Trail of Crumbs and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Wicked Wolf and Gilded Goose, while also generating card advantage with cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. The inclusion of versatile cards like Glass Casket and Emeria's Call allows the deck to adapt to various board states and maintain a proactive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and card draw, while ramping up mana to be able to cast powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck focuses on generating card advantage and creating threats with Shark Typhoon and Beanstalk Giant, ultimately overpowering the opponent with big spells and creatures. Additionally, the deck aims to fix its mana base with lands like Ketria Triome and Cragcrown Pathway to ensure consistent access to all its colors.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and mill effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the graveyard with cards like Cling to Dust and Agadeem's Awakening, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and win through card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an additional recursion element to further grind out games and provide resiliency against removal-heavy strategies.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game through various means. This is achieved by utilizing cards like Essence Scatter, Eliminate, Cling to Dust, Heartless Act, Lullmage's Domination, and Bloodchief's Thirst to remove threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also focuses on resource management with cards like Drown in the Loch and Into the Story to gain card advantage. Additionally, the deck has a mill sub-theme with Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, putting additional pressure on the opponent and potentially emptying their library.
